meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of humans.
meanings.sent1: The anthropical behavior of the child made everyone smile.
meanings.sent2: She had an anthropical way of understanding people's feelings.
meanings.sent3: The robot's attempt at anthropical emotions was both amusing and endearing.
meanings.sent4: His anthropical kindness shone through even in the toughest situations.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the essence of anthropical beauty in every stroke.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the study of human beings.
meanings.sent1: Anthropical research helps us understand our own species better.
meanings.sent2: The anthropologist's work is focused on anthropical studies.
meanings.sent3: The class on anthropical studies was both informative and engaging.
meanings.sent4: Her anthropical analysis shed light on the complexities of human behavior.
meanings.sent5: The book provided a fascinating insight into anthropical exploration.

meanings.sent1: The anthropical expression on his face revealed his true feelings.
meanings.sent2: The dog's anthropical loyalty was heartwarming.
meanings.sent3: The cat's anthropical curiosity led it into amusing situations.
meanings.sent4: Her anthropical compassion touched the hearts of everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed an anthropical bond between the characters that resonated with the audience.
